Dear Harry s
I have been planning to write you for some weeks, but the Holiday rush and
bustle was too much for me. Between the Radio-TV Arts department of the College,
and the duties of the TV Educational Foundation'^ general manager, I am kept
on the ru^ pretty steadily.
Perhaps you don’ t remember our conversation in St. Louis concerning some plans we
are tvying to develop© here in Cincinnati for a short two-week TV-Radio Institute.
The University of Cincinnati Sumer School Dean, Dr, Sponger Shank, has appointed
a committee of three or four UC professors and myself, to com© up with some Idea
/or Summer School Workshop in Radio-^V, to be offered by the University of Cincinnati
in cooperation with the Radio-TV Arts Department of the College of Music of
Cincinnati.
I have been instructed to contact you for the following Information, if you care to
divulge its
1) What type of course or subject matter would your organization HAEB be interested
in having presented in a two or three-week Radio-TV or TV Workshop this summer?
2) Would you be able to offer several scholarships to individuals interested in this
course or subjects if available in Cincinnati, so that we might have a backlog of
funds to help support the Workshop for this year?
Our thinking at present is along the following lines. We anticipate a two or three-
week Workshop as the most likely type of offering. We are considering the Television
field primarily, although radio can be covered as well either in conjunction with the
TV field or separately.
We are interested in such subject matter as techniques of production, writing,
programming and TV equipment operation; techniques of teaching by television? problems
of utilization of TV educational programs in the class room, as they affect the
average primary or secondary school teacher.
